intro: Telanthera caracasana, commonly known as the Caracas bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and branching. Telanthera caracasana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
